Topic.Title: Problem with page links in Gamebook mode

Posts.EditableText:
I was recently working on a Gamebook and decided to test it out, but after the second page there was an error with it

I receive this when I click the link: Error running script: Error evaluating expression 'DictionaryContains(player.parent.options, command)': DictionaryContains function expected dictionary parameter but was passed 'null'


I've sent an email on this issue too.

Posts.EditableText:
Did you try method 2 on the link Pertex gave you?

[quote:4mdv74nf]2) The GUI way. On a page that will have no links, still create a link and then delete it. For example, click "Link to Existing Page", pick some random page and then enter random text for the link. Then click the new link and delete it. That will leave an empty options dictionary on the page. [/quote:4mdv74nf]
Posts.HTML:
Did you try method 2 on the link Pertex gave you?

2) The GUI way. On a page that will have no links, still create a link and then delete it. For example, click "Link to Existing Page", pick some random page and then enter random text for the link. Then click the new link and delete it. That will leave an empty options dictionary on the page.

Posts.EditableText:

[quote:1xsjlxmv]2) The GUI way. On a page that will have no links, still create a link and then delete it. For example, click "Link to Existing Page", pick some random page and then enter random text for the link. Then click the new link and delete it. That will leave an empty options dictionary on the page. [/quote:1xsjlxmv][/quote:1xsjlxmv]
Ah now it comes together, 

one last thing does this work for one link or ALL links in the same game book
Posts.HTML:
jaynabonne wrote:Did you try method 2 on the link Pertex gave you?

2) The GUI way. On a page that will have no links, still create a link and then delete it. For example, click "Link to Existing Page", pick some random page and then enter random text for the link. Then click the new link and delete it. That will leave an empty options dictionary on the page.


Ah now it comes together,

one last thing does this work for one link or ALL links in the same game book

Posts.EditableText: It fixes the problem on a particular page. So you'll have to do it for each page that doesn't use the built-in links mechanism but rather just uses inline links.
Posts.HTML: It fixes the problem on a particular page. So you'll have to do it for each page that doesn't use the built-in links mechanism but rather just uses inline links.

Posts.EditableText: [quote="jaynabonne":1t6z1pvw]It fixes the problem on a particular page. So you'll have to do it for each page that doesn't use the built-in links mechanism but rather just uses inline links.[/quote:1t6z1pvw] Thanks guys the problem is fixed!

Thanks guys the problem is fixed!
